channel.title: Thedro on Portfolio - Thedro Neely
channel.description: Recent content in Thedro on Portfolio - Thedro Neely

item.title: Bulma Resume
item.author: thedroneely@gmail.com (Thedro Neely)
item.description: Live Website When you search for “CSS Framework” in DuckDuckGo, Bing, or Google, one of the top results happens to be Bulma.

item.title: My Sublime Text Setup
item.author: thedroneely@gmail.com (Thedro Neely)
item.description: Intro Sublime Text is a great general purpose performant text editor. It provides a lightweight interface and an excellent plugin packaging system.

item.title: Mixing PHP into Hugo
item.author: thedroneely@gmail.com (Thedro Neely)
item.description: Hugo is nice because of its blog template system, static site generation abilities and generic framework structure, but sometimes you may want to add extra functionality that requires dynamic content.

item.title: Now-DNS and pfSense
item.author: thedroneely@gmail.com (Thedro Neely)
item.description: The alternative to a static IP address is a server that keeps track of your dynamic IP address. When the IP address changes, the client will immediately notify the server of the new IP address.

item.title: Personal Portfolio
item.author: thedroneely@gmail.com (Thedro Neely)
item.description: Live Website This is the website you’re browsing right now. The general structure is based on design patterns from the Laravel PHP framework.

item.title: Voiceover Website
item.author: thedroneely@gmail.com (Thedro Neely)
item.description: Live Website Voice acting is one of my interests, and I’ve made a website to manage just that. There were a few super simple HTML, CSS, & JavaScript websites that I created before this one but I consider this my first formal website that actually does something.

item.title: GPU Accel on Remote Desktop
item.author: thedroneely@gmail.com (Thedro Neely)
item.description: Sometimes the solution to some problems are strange. Imagine a headless, remote, linux based desktop setup where users can remote into a graphical environment.

item.title: SSH Port Fowarding Tunnels
item.author: thedroneely@gmail.com (Thedro Neely)
item.description: The other day I needed to set up a Syncthing instance on a remotely networked server that had no graphical display.
